benchmark_details.name: CODE-ACCORD
benchmark_details.overview: CODE-ACCORD is a dataset of 862 self-contained sentences from the building regulations of England and Finland, annotated to facilitate machine-readable rule generation for Automatic Compliance Checking (ACC).

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To facilitate Automatic Compliance Checking (ACC) through machine-readable rule generation from building regulations.

data.source: Building regulations of England and Finland collected from official government sources.
data.annotation: Manual annotation by a team of 12 annotators with expertise in computer science and civil engineering.

methodology.calculation: Inter-annotator agreement (IAA) was used to measure annotation quality based on matches of annotated entities.
methodology.interpretation: High IAA values indicate congruence in entity recognition between annotators.
methodology.validation: Annotations were validated through multiple rounds and curated by domain experts.
